column4: hey guys i am running a vnc server, but it keeps opening port 5901 display1, i want it to show 5900 display 0 anway to get it to work that way
im using x11vnc
you may want to double check the x11vnc docs.   I recall it taking a little more work thenjust running it.
it used to work fine
use a lighter desktop, reduce the # of colors of the display. lower the res.
disable wallpaper and any extra effects.
i am already runningi at the lowest
for a windows vnc server - i tend to use 'ultravnc' it may have more tweaks.
even when running on my home network it runs the same as how it runs here at work
vnc can be sluggish. I agree
any better alternatives than vnc?
I only use vnc. freenx i hear works great for linux to linux.. but i dont do that.
i use the ultravnc server for windows. It  may have some addational speed up tweaks.
ultravnc, vnc4server, theres proberly a dozen vnc variants out.
ive found x11vnc to be VERY sluggish compared to the other 'vncservers'
yeah but its the only thing i can run that i KNOW of that runs my CURRENT display :0
i dont share current displays that makes it MUCH more sluggish also. :)
i keep my torrent/im/whatever in a nice littke session thats using jwm, for me to remote access
i find it decently quick when doing it that way.
jwm?
as i suggested earlier - use a very light window manager.
one has to wonder how they get sound...
You could alwasys run xming, and have the x apps appear locally.
